title: Companion to the Book
text: Companion Book “Investigating Statistical Concepts, Applications, Methods” package collates presents functions ISCAM alongside data used alongside textbook. don’t know function e.g. EXAMPLE() works, can write ?EXAMPLE console get help. Also look textbook/Canvas/homework see function used. see code like iscambinomprob(14, 16, .5, FALSE) text elsewhere, can generally use ISCAM::binomprob(14, 16, .5, FALSE). Workspace: load(url("http://www.rossmanchance.com/iscam3/ISCAM.RData")) package currently written minimal wrapper around workspace arrange package form. Almost code ported . Almost code written Dr. Beth Chance. Package collated Visruth SK.
code: # install.packages("pak") # uncomment this line and run it *once*  # options(use_bioconductor = FALSE) # do this is you get some issues running the next line when connected to the eduroam network pak::pkg_install("VisruthSK/ISCAM") # this installs or updates the package  # if {pak} doesn't work, try the following two commands #install.packages("remotes") #remotes::install_github("VisruthSK/ISCAM")  library(ISCAM) # this loads the package. You need to do this every time you want to use ISCAM functions

title: Cloud Seeding Data — CloudSeeding
text: lives depend rainfall. Consequently, scientists long investigated whether humans can intervene , needed, help nature produce rainfall. one study, researchers southern Florida explored whether injecting silver iodide cumulus clouds lead increased rainfall. 52 days judged suitable cloud seeding, target cloud identified plane flew target cloud order seed . Randomization used determine whether load seeding mechanism seed target cloud silver iodide day. Radar used measure volume rainfall selected cloud next 24 hours. results Simpson, Olsen, Eden, (1975) measure rainfall volume units acre-feet, “height” rain across one acre.

title: Cloud Seeding Data — CloudSeeding
text: data frame 52 rows 2 columns: treatment Whether cloud seeded silver iodide . rainfall Volume rainfall next 24 hours, acre-feet.

title: Cloud Seeding Data — CloudSeeding
text: https://www.jstor.org/stable/1268346

title: Elephant Walking Data — Elephants
text: Researchers Holdgate et al. (2016) studied walking behavior elephants North American zoos see whether difference average distance traveled African Asian elephants captivity. put GPS loggers 33 African elephants 23 Asian elephants, measured distance (kilometers) elephants walked per day.

title: Elephant Walking Data — Elephants
text: data frame 56 rows 2 columns: Species species Elephant . Distance many kilometers walked per day.

title: Elephant Walking Data — Elephants
text: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4944962/

title: Flint Michigan Lead Data — FlintMDEQ
text: Lead poisoning can serious problem associated drinking tap water. Many older water pipes made lead. time, pipes corrode, releasing lead drinking water. April 2014, city Flint Michigan switched water supply Flint River effort save money. Michigan Department Environmental Quality (MDEQ) tested water time declared safe drink. Officials supposed test least 100 homes, targeting risk. U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)’s Lead Copper Rule states lead concentrations exceed action level 15 parts per billion (ppb) 10% homes sampled, actions must undertaken control corrosion, public must informed.

title: Flint Michigan Lead Data — FlintMDEQ
text: data frame 71 rows 1 column: lead Lead concentration per household, measured parts per billion.

title: Flint Michigan Lead Data — FlintMDEQ

Additionally, functions accompanied plots. package designed used educational setting.

title: Infant Data — Infant
text: study reported November 2007 issue Nature, researchers investigated whether infants take account individual’s actions towards others evaluating individual appealing aversive, perhaps laying foundation social interaction (Hamlin, Wynn, Bloom, 2007). words, children aren’t even yet talking still form impressions someone’s friendliness based actions? one component study, 10-month-old infants shown “climber” character (piece wood “googly” eyes glued onto ) make hill two tries. infants shown two scenarios climber’s next try, one climber pushed top hill another character (“helper” toy) one climber pushed back hill another character (“hinderer” toy). infant alternately shown two scenarios several times. child presented pieces wood (helper hinderer characters) asked pick one play . Videos demonstrating component study can found http://campuspress.yale.edu/infantlab/media/.

title: Infant Data — Infant
text: data frame 16 rows 1 column: choice Whether baby selected "helper" "hinderer" toy.

title: Infant Data — Infant
text: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18033298/

title: Sleep Deprivation Data — SleepDeprivation
text: Researchers established sleep deprivation harmful effect visual learning (subject consolidate information improve task). Stickgold, James, Hobson (2000) investigated whether subjects “make ” sleep deprivation getting full night’s sleep subsequent nights. study involved randomly assigning 21 subjects (volunteers ages 18 25) one two groups: one group deprived sleep night following training visual discrimination task, group permitted unrestricted sleep first night. groups allowed unrestricted sleep following two nights, re-tested third day. Subjects’ performance test recorded minimum time (milliseconds) stimuli appearing computer screen accurately report seen screen. Previous studies shown subjects deprived sleep performed significantly worse following day, clear long negative effects last. data presented improvements reaction times (milliseconds), negative value indicates decrease performance.

title: Sleep Deprivation Data — SleepDeprivation
text: data frame 21 rows 2 columns: sleepcondition sleep condition subject . improvement subject's improvement reaction times, measured milliseconds.

title: Sleep Deprivation Data — SleepDeprivation
text: https://www.nature.com/articles/nn1200_1237

title: One Sample T-Test — onesamplet
text: onesamplet calculates one sample t-test /interval summary statistics. defaults hypothesized population mean 0. can optionally set alternative hypothesis confidence level two-sided confidence interval.

title: One Sample T-Test — onesamplet
code: onesamplet(   xbar,   sd,   n,   hypothesized = 0,   alternative = NULL,   conf.level = NULL )

title: One Sample T-Test — onesamplet
text: xbar Observed mean. sd Observed standard deviation. n Sample size. hypothesized Hypothesized population mean. alternative "less", "greater", "two.sided" conf.level Confidence level.

title: One Sample T-Test — onesamplet
text: t value, p value, confidence interval.

title: Some Summary Statistics — summary
text: summary calculates five number summary, mean, standard deviation quantitative variable x. optional second, categorical variable can specified values calculated separately group. number digits output can also specified.

title: Some Summary Statistics — summary
text: x data summarize. explanatory optional explanatory variable group . digits number digits round .

title: Some Summary Statistics — summary
text: table summary statistics x.

title: Some Summary Statistics — summary
code: set.seed(0) fake_data <- rnorm(30) # simulating some data groups <- sample(c("group1","group2"), 30, TRUE) summary(fake_data) #>   Missing  n   Min     Q1 Median    Q3   Max  Mean    SD #> 1       0 30 -1.54 -0.621 -0.031 0.487 2.405 0.022 0.914 summary(fake_data, explanatory = groups, digits = 2) # with groups #>        Missing  n   Min    Q1 Median   Q3  Max  Mean   SD #> group1       0 13 -1.24 -0.33  -0.06 0.44 1.26 -0.02 0.65 #> group2       0 17 -1.54 -0.89   0.13 0.76 2.40  0.05 1.09

title: Tail Probability for t-distribution — tprob
text: tail probability specified direction using given parameters.

title: Two Sample T-Test — twosamplet
text: twosamplet calculates two sample t-test /interval summary data. defaults hypothesized population mean difference 0. can optionally set alternative hypothesis confidence level two-sided confidence interval.

title: Two Sample T-Test — twosamplet
code: twosamplet(   x1,   sd1,   n1,   x2,   sd2,   n2,   hypothesized = 0,   alternative = NULL,   conf.level = 0 )

title: Two Sample T-Test — twosamplet
text: x1 Observed mean group 1. sd1 Observed standard deviation group 1. n1 Sample size group 1. x2 Observed mean group 2. sd2 Observed standard deviation group 2. n2 Sample size group 2. hypothesized Hypothesized difference population means. alternative "less", "greater", "two.sided" conf.level Confidence level.

title: Two Sample T-Test — twosamplet
text: t value, p value, confidence interval.
